meanings.definition: A being believed to have power over nature and human fortunes.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Greeks believed in a powerful god who controlled the weather.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, people pray to a god for good luck and protection.
meanings.sent3: When the storm hit, Sarah jokingly exclaimed, 'Oh god, please don't let my hair get ruined!'
meanings.sent4: The god of the sea seemed to be angry, as the waves crashed violently against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The god of thunder roared in the sky, announcing the arrival of the storm.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of supreme value or importance.
meanings.sent1: To her, her grandmother was a god who always knew how to make things better.
meanings.sent2: In the world of fashion, Coco Chanel is considered a god for revolutionizing women's clothing.
meanings.sent3: As a chocolate lover, Mark declared the new dessert as the 'god of all sweets'.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was like a god in the company, making all the important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher became a god in the eyes of her students after helping them succeed in their exams.

meanings.definition: Used as an exclamation of surprise, anger, or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Oh god, I can't believe I forgot my homework at home!
meanings.sent2: God, why does this always happen to me?
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, Sarah exclaimed, 'God, not again!'
meanings.sent4: God, that was a close call with the car almost hitting the dog!
meanings.sent5: God, it's so hot outside, I feel like I'm melting!
